items.title: Can the federal budget reset Canada's economy?
items.description: Canada's economy is suffering. The Bank of Canada says interest rate cuts can only do so much. So it's passed the baton to the federal government. This week's budget can do what the central bank cannot: restructure how the Canadian economy grows.

items.title: Canada collected $3B from U.S. counter-tariffs before a majority were dropped
items.description: Canada had collected more than $3 billion through U.S. counter-tariffs before removing a swath of levies in September, according to the Finance Department — far less than what the Liberals had promised to rake in during the current fiscal year.

items.title: Soraya Martinez Ferrada is Montreal's next mayor, CBC News projects
Former federal minister Soraya Martinez Ferrada elected mayor of Montreal
items.description: Montreal's new mayor has pledged to tackle homelessness and to audit the city's bike paths, which have sparked a backlash from some drivers and business owners.

items.title: 'We'll be back': What's next for the Blue Jays after heartbreaking World Series loss?
items.description: While the Blue Jays heal physically, general manager Ross Atkins has some work to do too. Several key players from Toronto's playoff run are set to become free agents in the off-season.

items.title: Toronto transit services under fire for not extending service following World Series Game 7
items.description: Toronto public transit services and politicians are facing backlash on social media following Game 7 of the World Series because some transit services were not extended past 1:30 a.m.

items.title: Albertans shouldn't expect a ‘general strike' anytime soon
items.description: While Alberta labour groups promised swift retribution after the province forced teachers back to work, the head of the union admits a general strike won't happen overnight.

items.title: CPKC train derails near B.C. community, officials say no danger to water system
items.description: The Canadian Pacific Kansas City railway company says a locomotive and several cars, some with fuel, derailed on Saturday. TNRD officials say clean-up efforts are underway.

items.title: Say Hi to Tech Bro Carney
items.description: As his government heedlessly embraces artificial intelligence, the threats to Canadians are clear.

items.title: After World Series loss, what's next for the Toronto Blue Jays?
items.description: Following the Toronto Blue Jays' heartbreaking Game 7 loss, some of the players are set to become free agents in the off-season, so what's next for the team.

items.title: Newfoundland's Between Breaths makes Western Canadian debut at the Firehall
items.description: A moving look at Dr. Jon Lien’s life, from rescuing whales to facing dementia.

items.title: Bruno Marchand wins second term as mayor of Quebec City
items.description: As the incumbent mayor, Marchand had to defend his record against attacks from his opponents during the campaign.

items.title: Alberta hunter recalls own grizzly bear close call, urges hunting safety
items.description: A hunter is recalling how he was almost attacked by a grizzly bear in Alberta six years ago in the same location where another man was attacked earlier this week.

items.title: Five underrated Halloween horror films for the spooky season's final stretch
items.description: From toy rabbits to punk-club green rooms, prepare to be scared.

items.description: “We do work hard to play his music well."

items.title: You Nearly Missed: Our top picks from the 2025 Chilliwack Independent Film Festival
items.description: From cult cinema to queer storytelling, five standout picks from this year’s program.

items.title: Photos: Shawn Mendes returns to Rogers Arena “proud to be Canadian”
items.description: It was an emotional night for Mendes and his fans.

items.title: The final scoop: Dolce Amore goes full service
items.description: Dolce Amore levels up from gelato empire to full-blown Italian affair.

items.title: B.C.'s breweries warn that unless tax rules change, the industry will suffer

items.title: Glitch Theatre debuts with neurodivergent-led premiere
items.description: New name, new mandate, and a neurodivergent-led creative team define the company’s 2025 launch.

items.title: Suki’s: Fifty-four years of style, education, and legacy
items.description: For 54 years, Suki’s has shaped Vancouver’s hair culture through artistry and education. Named Best Salon in the Georgia Straight’s Best of Vancouver 2025, the iconic brand continues to set the standard for innovation, collaboration, and timeless style—from its world-class Academy to its visionary team.

items.title: Measles Update #41

Man charged in fatal shooting at SUV
items.description: Police in Saskatchewan say a man has been charged in a September shooting on a stretch of highway that claimed the life of Tanya Myers, a passenger in an SUV.

items.title: Nova Scotia's Kate Beaton has her Ducks in a row at Vancouver Writers Fest
items.description: The graphic novellist and children's book author makes her way to Vancouver.

items.title: Dusty duffel bag found in Italy revives story of Cape Bretoner killed in WW II
items.description: Michele Facchini, a Second World War researcher, found a duffel bag of a Cape Breton soldier in Italy. With it, Facchini unearthed the story of Hector Colin McDonald.
